abstract: Economic growth in the United States picks up in the third quarter in latest encouraging sign that recovery, while painfully slow, has not stalled; gross domestic product grew at a 2.5 percent annual rate, but it is not enough to recover ground lost during the recession, relieve unemployment or even entirely dispel fears of a second recession.
snippet: Gross domestic product grew at a 2.5 percent annual rate in the third quarter, an improvement but not enough to recover ground lost during the recession.
lead_paragraph: Gross domestic product grew at a 2.5 percent annual rate in the third quarter, an improvement but not enough to recover ground lost during the recession.

headline.main: U.S. Economy Picks Up Pace, Averting a Stall
headline.print_headline: U.S. Economy Picks Up Pace, Averting a Stall
